abstract.p: Bertrand, R. M., Saczynski, J. S., Mezzacappa, C., Hulse, M., Ensrud, K., & Fredman, L. (2012). Caregiving and cognitive function in older women: Evidence for the healthy caregiver hypothesis. Journal of Aging and Health, 24(1), 48-66. (Original DOI: 10.1177/0898264311421367)

body.p: In the above article, the affiliation for Dr. Bertrand currently reads, “Health Policy, Abt Associates Inc., Cambridge, MA, USA,” and the affiliation for Dr. Saczynski currently reads, “Domestic Health Division, Health Policy, Abt Associates Inc., Cambridge, MA, USA.” The affiliation for Dr. Bertrand should have read, “Domestic Health Division, Health Policy, Abt Associates Inc., Cambridge, MA, USA,” and the affiliation for Dr. Saczynski should have read, “University of Massachusetts Medical School and Meyers Primary Care Institute, Worcester, MA, USA.”
The funding statement on page 62 in the above article should have included the following statement:
“Dr. Saczynski was supported in part by funding from the National Institute on Aging (K01 AG33643) and the National Heart Lung and Blood Institute (U01 HL105268).”
